keyword: calories in a chicken thigh skinless
title: Calories in a Skinless Chicken Thigh
meta_description: Discover calories in a chicken thigh skinless: about 179 kcal for one (~100g cooked), plus protein, fat, carbs, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Skinless Chicken Thigh
assumptions: Boneless, skinless chicken thigh, cooked (roasted or grilled), no added oil, sauce, or seasoning; standard size ~100g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, size, and brand. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: One skinless chicken thigh (~100g cooked) provides ~179 kcal and 24g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in a chicken thigh skinless?
faqs.a: About 179 kcal for one (~100g cooked, boneless).

faqs.q: What's the protein in a skinless chicken thigh?
faqs.a: Roughly 24g protein per thigh, making it a lean option.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in a chicken thigh skinless?
faqs.a: Yes; roasting or grilling keeps it low, while frying adds ~50-100 kcal from oil.

faqs.q: Are carbs present in a skinless chicken thigh?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”it's primarily protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does size impact calories in a chicken thigh skinless?
faqs.a: Larger thighs (~125g) add ~45 kcal; smaller (~75g) subtract ~45 kcal.
